content.description: The technical crux is on the first pitch 1/2 way up. Two long pitches will get you to the top. It may be best to split the second pitch into 2 pitches for less rope drag though.
content.location: This is the long offwidth/chimney on the East Side of Devil's Canyon before the Phantom Spire (on the same wall).

content.description: OW and chimney moves will get you up this. There is a tree sling anchor.
content.location:
Hike the D2 trail, stay left as you enter Devil's Canyon. Once you get above the schist vein, there will be a large boulder on the left. Follow a narrow trail up to the Phantom Spire Wall. This route is climber's right of the "Devil's Gate Tower". Climbing this will gain the ledge that

Vyasa

starts on.

content.description: This crack is excellent!!! Unfortunately the 30 feet below it and the 30 feet above it are not easily protected, if at all. Fortunately the last 30 feet, while only protectable by a single #5, is 5.7 climbing. The first 30 feet is yet to be climbed, but it looks like it will go.
content.location: This is the obvious dihedral crack on the wall behind The Phantom Spire. Set a hanging belay on two #2 cams at the top of the crack (or deal with serious rope drag on the final unprotected 30 feet). Then climb easy but unprotected poor rock for 20 feet to a #5 placement. Then crank up on a vibrating finger, and climb up the final 10 foot corner to the top.... Belay off the tree.
